attributes.comment:
We are adopting a child from China and are currently in the waiting process for our
match. It is currently estimated that the wait time is between 17-20 months and
has been getting longer each month. By the time we get out match it is estimated
that it will be 24-26 months after we were logged into the system in China. That
time frame is longer than out I-600A is valid for. The costs of filing the I-600A is
not cheap for most families as is the case for all of the adoption fees. Adoptions
are very expensive and having to re-apply for a form that we have already filed for
just because the US government has given it an expiration date that is unrealistic
is unfair to families that are spending a lot of money to adopt a child. I rewuest
that the expiration time of the I-600A be extended to at least 30 months in order to
ensure that the families that have already filed and received their I-171H do not
have to re-file again and spend another $685, or the proposed $830 when it
expires.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Shawn M. McAvoy
